title: S-, S, S+ Mastery System process
body:
Hey guys, so I know this type of thread may or may not be found elsewhere but I feel like sharing my personal experience and getting help from the community may shed some light on how/why the mastery system works the way it does.

Recently I've played a few game where I personally (as well as mate) believe I played quite well. For example, I played a normal game today and picked {{champion:107}}  as I play a lot of jungle (Rank master 6 rengar) thinking that if i did really well this game that I would get a token towards my rank 7. At the end of a 31min game i was 15/1/7 with 115cs (predominantly jungle cs) which racked up to 14k gold. 

I am aware that cs does contribute towards the decision on what rating you get in each game  but I thought that at the least an S- was in order... If anyone could shed some light on something that I might be missing that would be great, or maybe my cs just wasn't up to par?

replies.body:
It isn't a set score you need to achieve, it's all relative to how everyone else on the server is doing with the **same champ in the same role**. The system used to grade people is the same on all servers, it just that you get compared to a different pool of players. 

From Riot:

> It’s based on the champion and role that you just played in a game. So, for example, we look at Annie mid differently to Annie support. We take a series of performance metrics and compare how you do to all other players in your region in your champion / position combination. It is percentile driven - so earning a high score means** you performed in the top x% of players** on that champ in that position. The grade itself governs the point gains.

[(Source)](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery)

[Basically grades similarly to a bell curve](http://study.com/academy/lesson/bell-curve-definition-impact-on-grades.html), meaning we have a server full of really good players. 

**Riot hasn't released a list of the factors that contribute to a high grade, but I know from experience that the jg rengar boundary is high af* ♥
